eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: EllipseMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
description: - smoothly vertically or horizontally (by setting one radius to 0)
- on a sine wave (by adding a force)
- Making objects float, such as powerups or coins
- Making a player constantly turn right or left ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://star-seeker))

events.comment: Evaluate the center of movement from the object position and properties.

Save the position to detect when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Update the movement angle for the next frame.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: BoidsMovement
description: Simulates swarms or flocks movement following the separation, alignment, cohesion principles. The flock can be attracted to a location or avoid some obstacles.
The [Fish School example](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://fish-school) shows how properties impact on the movement.

eventsFunctions.description: Define JavaScript classes.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineJavaScript

inlineCode: * @param {float} x - coordinate of the vectors starting position
* @param {float} y - coordinate of the vectors starting position
* Adds a velocity to this vector
* @param {Vector} referenceVector gets the velocity to be added
* Subtracts vectors verticies from a reference vector
* Methods for Separation, Cohesion, Alignment added
* Inspired from The Nature of Code - Daniel Shiffman
* @param {Vector} vector the vector to return the result
* Applys the three rules of boids
* Apply the acceleration from the steer force.
* Calculates and applies steering force towards a direction
* Alignment: calculate the average velocity for every nearby boid in the system
* Cohesion: calculate direction vector towards the average location of all nearby boids
// A vector pointing from the position to the target
* Add a boid to the R-Tree.
* Remove a boid from the R-Tree.
* Returns all the boids around the specified boid.
* @return {Boid[]} An array with all boids near the object.
// TODO The R-Tree should not allocate an array.
// Cap the number of boids between 20 and 40.
for (let i = 0; i < nearbys.length; i += step) {

eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ intend to avoid a radius of _PARAM4_ around _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ (decision weight: _PARAM5_)

events.comment:
Evaluate at which distance the object will go past a location if it were to continue in its current direction.

speedUnitX = velocityX / speed
speedUnitY = velocityY / speed

deltaX = centerX - object.CenterX
deltaY = centerY - object.CenterY

normalX = -deltaY;
normalY = deltaX;

trajectoryDistance = speedUnitX * normalX + speedUnitY * normalY
If this distance is smaller than the specified radius, the Boid must try turn in the right direction to avoid the area.
(normalX ; normalY)
(-normalX ; -normalY)

eventsFunctions.description: Intend to avoid an area from an object center and a given radius.

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Pass the configuration to the behavior (MaxValue must be set before Value).

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.
